note.note-paragraph:
Attention is drawn to the following places:
A47J27/08 Pressure cookers
E04B1/68 Sealing building joints
E05C9/00 Multi-point fastening of wings in general
F01B Machines or engines in general or of reciprocating type, e.g. cylinders peculiar to steam engines
F01B31/28
F02F1/00 Cylinders for combustion engines
F02F3/00 Pistons for combustion engines
F04D29/08 Sealings of non-positive displacement pumps
F17B1/04 Sealing devices for sliding parts of gas holders of variable capacity
F28F9/04 Arrangements for sealing elements into header boxes or end plates of heat-exchangers.

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
F16J15/53 covered by F16J15/43
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: bellows pistons F16J3/06; piston-rings or seats therefor F16J9/00;

; rotary pistons, e.g. for "Wankel" type engines F01C; specific for combustion engines, i.e. constructed to withstand high temperature or modified for guiding, igniting, vaporising or otherwise treating the charge F02F;

title-part.text: characterised by the use of particular materials
Resilient guiding parts, e.g. skirts, particularly for trunk pistons
with rolling contact, other than in ball or roller bearings
designed to give the piston some rotary movement about its axis

reference.text: connection of valves to inflatable elastic bodies B60C29/00; bellows or the like used in instruments G12B1/04; diaphragms for electromechanical transducers H04R7/00

CPC-specific-text.text: with particular means for limiting wear

reference.text: other sealings between pistons and cylinders F16J3/06, F16J15/16
; tools for mounting or removing piston-rings or the like B25B; piston sealing arrangements on brake master cylinders B60T11/236

CPC-specific-text.text: ; sealing provided on pump pistons F04B53/143
using metallic coiled or blade springs
Coiled spring along the entire circumference
Strip or wire along the entire circumference
Rings with a flat annular side rail
with a "C"-shaped cross section along the entire circumference

title-part.text: with expansion obtained by pressure of the medium
Special members for adjusting the rings

note.note-paragraph: The group F16J9/203 is no longer used for the classification of new documents from August 1st, 2002. The backlog of this group is being continuously reclassified to F16J9/206, and to F16J9/06 and sub-groups

title-part.text: Rings for preventing wear of grooves or like seatings
Members preventing rotation of rings in grooves
characterised by the use of particular materials

reference.text: pressure vessels in general F16J12/00; cylinders for engines or other apparatus of particular kinds, see the appropriate subclasses, e.g. for combustion engines F02F

title-part.text: Features of hollow, e.g. cylindrical, bodies in general
Cylinders designed to receive moving pistons or plungers

reference.text: covers therefor F16J13/00; for particular applications, see the relevant subclasses, e.g. B01J, F17C, G21C

title-part.text: Covers or similar closure members for pressure vessels in general

reference.text: for engines or like cylinders F16J10/00; sealings F16J15/02; covers for box-like containers B65D43/00; devices for securing or retaining closure members B65D45/00; closures for containers not otherwise provided for B65D51/00; manholes, covers for large containers B65D90/10; gates or closures for large containers B65D90/54; for vessels for containing or storing compressed, liquefied or solidified gases F17C13/06; steam boilers F22B

title-part.text: attached only by clamps along the circumference

CPC-specific-text.text: the clamp comprising a ring encircling the flange

title-part.text: attached by one or more members actuated to project behind a part or parts of the frame

reference.text: similar constructions for doors or windows E05C9/00

title-part.text: attached by means of a divided ring
attached by wedging action by means of screw-thread, interrupted screw-thread, bayonet closure, or the like
attached exclusively by spring action or elastic action
mounted by mobile fastening on swinging arms
with movement parallel to the plane of the opening
with safety devices, e.g. to prevent opening prior to pressure release

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising at least two sealings in succession
forming of recuperation chamber for the leaking fluid
with provision to put out of action at least one sealing; One sealing sealing only on standstill; Emergency or servicing sealings
the packing being locally weakened in order to increase elasticity
and with at least one flexible lip
the packing being mechanically expanded against the sealing surface

title-part.text: without packing between the surfaces, e.g. with ground surfaces, with cutting edge
with solid packing compressed between sealing surfaces

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the geometry of the seat
the packing combining the sealing function with other functions
the packing swelling under working conditions
characterised by material or surface treatment
with a braided or knitted body
with an edge portion folded over a second plate or shim
with an edge portion folded over the plate itself
with a non-metallic coating or strip
Aspects not related to the edges of the gasket
the sealing effect being obtained by plastic deformation of the packing
the sealing effect being obtained by elastic deformation of the packing
the packing having a hollow profile
Special methods for making a non-metallic packing
Details relating to the edges of the packing
consisting of additions, e.g. metallic fibres, metallic powders, randomly dispersed in the packing
the reinforcement being a compression stopper

title-part.text: by means of granular or plastic material, or fluid

reference.text: F16J15/50, F16J15/52 take precedence; bellows pistons F16J3/06; piston-rings or ring sealings of similar construction F16J9/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Special parts or details relating to lubrication or cooling of the sealing itself
the sealing action depending on movements; pressure difference, temperature or presence of leaking fluid
with means to prevent the extrusion of the packing
which permits material to be continuously conveyed

title-part.text: with stuffing-boxes for elastic or plastic packings

CPC-specific-text.text: with lubricating, cooling or draining means
with continuous adjustment of the compression of the packing
Means for facilitating the removal of the packing

title-part.text: shaped as strands, ropes, threads, ribbons, or the like
with radially or tangentially compressed packing
with stuffing-boxes for rigid sealing rings
with sealing rings made of metal
with sealing rings made of carbon
provided with tension elements, e.g. elastic rings
supported in a direction parallel to the surfaces
supported in a direction perpendicular to the surfaces
capable of accommodating changes in distances or misalignment between the surfaces, e.g. able to compensate for defaults of eccentricity or angular deviations
formed by deforming a flat ring
with at least one lip for each surface, e.g. U-cup packings
Arrangements for lubrication or cooling of the sealing itself
comprising two casing or support elements, one attached to each surface, e.g. cartridge or cassette seals
with means for detecting or measuring relative rotation of the two elements
the elements being separable from each other
the rings having a break or opening, e.g. to enable mounting on a shaft otherwise than from a shaft end
with additional static sealing between the sealing, or its casing or support, and the surface on which it is mounted
Manufacturing methods specially adapted for elastic sealings
Arrangements for monitoring the condition or operation of elastic sealings
Arrangements for control of elastic sealings, e.g. of their geometry or stiffness
with slip-ring pressed against a more or less radial face on one member

CPC-specific-text.text: and characterised by parts or details relating to lubrication, cooling or venting of the seal
at least one ring having an uneven slipping surface
with at least one continuous groove
with means for feeding fluid directly to the face
the geometry of the surface being able to vary during operation
the pressing force being applied by means of an elastic ring supporting the slip-ring
the pressing force resulting from fluid pressure
the pressing force resulting from the action of a spring
without external means for pressing the ring against the face, e.g. slip-ring with a resilient lip
the pressing force varying during operation
Means for controlling the deformations of the contacting faces
Means for centering or aligning the contacting faces
Means for minimising vibrations of the slip-ring
with monitoring or measuring means associated with the seal
the diaphragm or bellow being made of metal
by changing the state of matter

title-part.text: kept in sealing position by centrifugal force
kept in sealing position by magnetic force

CPC-specific-text.text: with facing materials having honeycomb-like structure
with means for adjusting the clearance

title-part.text: characterised by the use of particular materials
with packing ring expanded or pressed into place by fluid pressure, e.g. inflatable packings

reference.text: connection of valves to inflatable elastic bodies B60C29/00;

CPC-specific-text.text: for sealing arrangements in vehicles B60J10/244; for sealing arrangements of openings in buildings E06B7/2318

title-part.text: influenced by the pressure within the member to be sealed
between relatively-movable members, by means of a sealing without relatively-moving surfaces, e.g. fluid-tight sealings for transmitting motion through a wall
by means of sealing bellows or diaphragms

reference.text: connection of valves to inflatable elastic bodies B60C29/00

CPC-specific-text.text: fixed to a part of a transmission performing a wobbling or a circular translatory movement
submitted to unbalanced pressure in circumference; seals for oscillating actuator
